sub_title: Community Facilitator & Messaging Expert - Elevate Your Impact-Driven Business with Connection, Conversation and Collaboration
summary:
Hi, I’m Mags! I am a storyteller, a rabble-rouser and a connector of people. I am also the founder of House of Hives and Editor-In-Chief of FEM Magazine. So, how did we get to this point? Let me take you on a bit of a journey!

I started my entrepreneurial journey in 2013 when I co-founded SwanWaters, a platform for people recovering from emotional abuse. This is where my personal story and business first intertwined and I became fully aware of the power of personal stories. I learned some of those lessons the hard way, leaving me feeling exposed and anxious. So, I decided to help others tap into the power of their story, without the massive vulnerability hangover. 

The platform has since lost funding, unfortunately, but the content I created for it has resulted in my book ‘The Ugly Duckling Diary’.

**Founding House of Hives**
When I first founded House of Hives, I wanted it to be a place where women would empower women, who in their turn empower women. Female empowerment squared. Although my team doesn’t only include women anymore, this mission hasn’t changed.

I work with people who have greater goals than just running a business. They aspire to contribute positively to the world, shift narratives, and empower clients through their lived experiences.

However, the realities of running a business can sometimes dim the initial excitement, leading to self-doubt and overwhelm. Questions may arise about the true impact they can make from behind their humble laptops.

I believe in the power of collaboration to create meaningful impact and lasting change. Together, we can achieve more and uplift each other on our journeys of growth and transformation.

**A world in flux**
Since the founding of House of Hives in February 2020, the world has been in a state of flux, to say the least. It means we need more people to stand up and raise their voices and challenge the narrative.

In this world, I am committed to lifting those voices and creating a supportive environment for my clients and creating powerful collaborative connections that will create a ripple effect of impact throughout the world. 

I bring 10 years of experience with online marketing, a lifetime of writing and storytelling experience and my natural gifts to reframe your content and connect with people on a deep level to the table. All of that makes me the best ambassador your business has ever had!

With a little help from your friendly neighbourhood marketing maverick, you will feel empowered and encouraged to keep bringing light to this world!

education.field_of_study: International Degree in English and Education

awards.title: BRAINZ 500 GLOBAL 2020 honouree
awards.description: I was selected by Brainz Magazine as one of a total of 500 Companies, Entrepreneurs, Influential Leaders and Business Owners recognized for their entrepreneurial success, achievements or dedication to help others. More information: https://www.brainzmagazine.com/brainz-500-global/mags-thomson

projects.title: Bodies in the Basement
projects.description:
I have had the immense privilege to edit Aubrey’s book Bodies in the Basement. It is available on Amazon 

Aubrey, I couldn’t be more proud of you, my dear friend.

When Aubrey suggested that SwanWaters publish her previous writings in a book I began reading and editing. It was quite an emotional journey for me, too. After all, we are both survivors… and reading each other’s stories almost always have some emotional effect. It validates our own experiences, gives new insight… it can be quite an emotional roller coaster. Aubrey’s writing always goes straight to the heart of the matter.

Aubrey is (as always) committed to writing raw and within the moment. There are no embellishments, nothing is made to look or sound better than it is. This is what makes her words so easy to relate to. 
Even after years of healing, almost every single chapter gave me some new insight, some new learning or healing.

Maybe what I am trying to say is that the book will be an interesting read for anyone, anywhere on the healing journey. It will help people figure out what is going on when they still are in a toxic relationship, it will give you valuable insight into healing yourself, coping with the aftermath of abuse, and even give you support when dealing with continued abuse through the courts or other proxies.

The book is divided into sections that each deal with a certain aspect of Aubrey’s journey. You can skip through the book and read the chapters on topics that are relevant to you at that moment. Maybe you are feeling you have a spiritual crisis, or dealing with an ex in court… just skip to the relevant section and get reading.

projects.title: Automating Application Process Export Coaching Programme
projects.description: CBI organises many Export Coaching Programmes in different countries around the world. In order to streamline the application process, communication with candidates and administrative processes involved, we are working on an interface that will allow candidates to enter their application and follow their progress. At the same time it aims to simplify and speed-up processing and administration within CBI.

profile_positions.description:
House of Hives helps women entrepreneurs with new meaningful ways to grow and promote their businesses. By working together, B2B coaches and service providers co-create publicity, authority and reach for their businesses. Collectively, we create a ripple effect of impact by uplifting each other and each other’s clients.

Our community is full of people who want to do things differently. They want to change the world through the work they do, but they also want to change how we talk about and run our businesses. Whether they are service providers who help their clients rethink marketing, sales or business development, or B2C entrepreneurs who are looking for inspiration on how they can make their businesses feel more aligned. One thing is certain, the people in our community are not your run-of-the-mill, dime-a-dozen online entrepreneurs. They are trailblazers, rabble-rousers and odd-ducks.

The House of Hives Business Development Community is more than JUST a place to network. It’s a collective of passionate, impact-driven entrepreneurs who are changing the world together!
profile_positions.title: Content Consultant & Messaging Expert

profile_positions.description:
House of Hives is home to a community of passionate coaches and service providers who co-create FEM to inspire and encourage impact-driven entrepreneurs to change their lives, their businesses and the world!
Are you looking for inspiration and encouragement to ditch bro-marketing, lack-mindset and over-competitive hustle culture? Are you ready to embrace balance, collaboration, abundance and diversity in your business? Do you want to create impact and positive change in the world? Then FEM is for you!
profile_positions.title: Editor In Chief FEM Magazine

profile_positions.description: Executive Contributors at Brainz Magazine are handpicked and invited to contribute because of their knowledge and valuable insight within their area of expertise.
profile_positions.title: Executive Contributor

profile_positions.description:
Are you a mental health professional, coach or healer? Do you feel overwhelmed by your business? Would you like to scale up, but you don't know where to start? The answer is simple: get help!

My name is Mags and I have been a virtual assistant for many years. More specifically, I have been an assistant for people in your field. That means I understand trauma, I understand the subtleties and the importance of confidentiality and tact. You don't have to explain your business to me because I get it.

Hiring me to take some of the task off your hands that do not bring you joy, will give you energy to do what you do best: help people feel better. Without the drain on your time and energy, you to create space for creative thinking and hopefully some more fun!

My Superpowers are: Content (Co-)Creation, Social Media Management, Processes and Systems.
profile_positions.title: Virtual Assistant for Mental Health Professionals, Coaches and Healers
Author, Speaker, and Operations Manager

company.name: CBI - Centre for the Promotion of Imports from developing countries

profile_positions.company: CBI - Centre for the Promotion of Imports from developing countries
profile_positions.title: Senior Project Officer

profile_positions.description:
Within the joint offices of several Dutch AIDS charities (STI AIDS Netherlands) I worked for AIDS Action Europe: 
•	providing administrative support to the Civil Society Forum on HIV and AIDS
•	financial reporting regarding the EU Operating Grant, 
•	making arrangements for Steering Group meetings
•	editing and formatting reports and policy notes.

The diversity of task greatly contributed to flexibility and the ability to quickly gain understanding of expectations. Working in an organisation that provides policy advice to the European Commission and is actively involved in the lobby for better policies in Europe and Central Asia gave a good insight in the workings of politics at this level.
profile_positions.title: Programme Assistant

profile_positions.description:
Within the joint offices of several Dutch AIDS charities (STI AIDS Netherlands) I worked for the grants department of Aids Fonds. Tasks included: 
•	grants administration and liaising with local partners and grant recipients, 
•	developing and recording procedures and work processes, 
•	editing and formatting reports and policy notes.

This job required a great eye for detail and a clear overview in about 250 files, all in different stages of the grants process. I discovered and developed a talent for introducing efficient work processes to teams, and recording these to benefit day to day work and training of new staff.
profile_positions.title: Grants Administrator

profile_positions.description:
YFU is an international non-profit organisation that facilitates home stay exchange programmes for teens between the ages of 15 and 21. I worked on several temporary contracts from 2002. From May 2007 I was employed full-time. My job at that time included:
•	day to day management of paid and volunteer staff, and vocational interns, 
•	overseeing of administrative work, 
•	liaising with colleagues concerning the well-being of students and the execution of the programmes, 
•	managing service providers and upkeep of office facilities, 
•	revision of promotional materials such as websites and brochures.

Working with volunteers and within an international network helped me develop excellent communication skills. Although I have always been a social person, this job especially developed my teamwork skills. As there were so many parties involved, from regional volunteers to parents and international office staff. I became very skilled at managing information streams, so that all parties had the information they needed, whilst also respecting the delicate nature of some of the issues we dealt with.
profile_positions.title: Office Manager

profile_positions.description:
I work as the Dutch language support for the internal European helpdesk for the expense management tool for Shell employees.
Tasks included 
•	providing information to internal customers by email and telephone, 
•	liaising between customers and second line support teams, 
•	managing changing workload and delegating work across the team.

As part of the first line support I learned to question issues and find the best solutions. Also working at a helpdesk really develops your ability to respond to changing circumstances as the workload is difficult to predict and system changes often occurred.
profile_positions.title: SAP TMS First Line Analyst

profile_positions.description: I volunteered to present a weekly show featuring the best of Dutch music, as well as film releases to video, and occational interviews with locals.
profile_positions.title: Radio Presenter (volunteer)
